  • Set projects, tasks, checklists and parts of the project structure back to New
  • View page source

Set projects, tasks, checklists and parts of the project structure back to NewÂ¶

A project manager can postpone a project, parts of the project structure or individual elements using a status change to New. Postponing requires that the higher-level technical object has a valid status for postponement.

The following applies to postponing tasks: The super task must be in the New, Ready or Execution status. The project must be in the New or Execution status.

The following applies to postponing checklists: The assigned task must be in the New or Ready status. Postponing a technical object propagates downwards within the project structure. This means all of the subtasks and all of the checklists assigned there are also postponed.
